values.authorQuote: We need business to understand its social responsibility, that the main task and objective for a business is not to generate extra income and to become rich and transfer the money abroad, but to look and evaluate what a businessman has done for the country, for the people, on whose account he or she has become so rich.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: Terrorism has no nationality or religion.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: Those who fight corruption should be clean themselves.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: We should not just consume hydrocarbon fuel but use it to develop nuclear energy, hydro power and renewable energy sources.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: We are all different, but when we ask for the Lord's blessings, we must not forget that God created us equal.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: The ability to compromise is not a diplomatic politeness toward a partner but rather taking into account and respecting your partner's legitimate interests.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: I don't read books by people who have betrayed the Motherland.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: I think the international community should unite to fight such inhuman phenomena as terror attacks and the murder of totally innocent people.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: Russia is a part of European culture. Therefore, it is with difficulty that I imagine NATO as an enemy.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: In many countries today, moral and ethical norms are being reconsidered; national traditions, differences in nation and culture are being erased.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: Nobody should have any illusion about the possibility of gaining military superiority over Russia. We will never allow this to happen.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: Above all, such sports as judo, in my view, teach people to relate to each other. They teach us to respect a partner, teach us to understand that an externally weak partner can not only put up worthy resistance, but, if you relax and take too much for granted, may even win.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: Everything will probably never be OK. But we have to try for it.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: The task of the government is not only to pour honey into a cup, but sometimes to give bitter medicine.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: At last, Russia has returned to the world arena as a strong state - a country that others heed and that can stand up for itself.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: My notion of the KGB came from romantic spy stories. I was a pure and utterly successful product of Soviet patriotic education.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: I would prefer to abandon the terminology of the past. 'Superpower' is something which we used during the cold war time. Why use it now?
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: China has created very good investment tools, including an entire network of very large funds. The Russian Private Investment Fund works with some of those funds, with China's largest investment funds.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: No one should be allowed to violently trample on the law.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: No one wants the United Nations to suffer the fate of the League of Nations, which collapsed because it lacked real leverage. This is possible if influential countries bypass the United Nations and take military action without Security Council authorization.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: Journalism, as concerns collecting information, differs little if at all from intelligence work. In my judgment, a journalist's job is very interesting.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: NATO was built to counteract the Soviet Union in its day and time. At this point there is no threat coming from the Soviet Union, because there is no Soviet Union anymore. And where there was the Soviet Union once, there is now a number of countries, among them the new and democratic Russia.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: At least in Russia, you cannot just go and tap into someone's phone conversation without a warrant issued by court. That's more or less the way a civilized society should go about fighting terrorism.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: It is extremely dangerous to encourage people to see themselves as exceptional, whatever the motivation.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: Thieves must sit in prison.
values.author: Vladimir Putin

values.authorQuote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Nature has always had more force than education.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Appreciation is a wonderful thing: It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Tears are the silent language of grief.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: When it is a question of money, everybody is of the same religion.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: The art of medicine consists in amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Each player must accept the cards life deals him or her: but once they are in hand, he or she alone must decide how to play the cards in order to win the game.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Optimism is the madness of insisting that all is well when we are miserable.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: No problem can withstand the assault of sustained thinking.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Superstition is to religion what astrology is to astronomy the mad daughter of a wise mother. These daughters have too long dominated the earth.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: It is better to risk saving a guilty man than to condemn an innocent one.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Common sense is not so common.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Everything's fine today, that is our illusion.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: One great use of words is to hide our thoughts.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Man is free at the moment he wishes to be.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: The public is a ferocious beast; one must either chain it or flee from it.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Let us read and let us dance - two amusements that will never do any harm to the world.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: The safest course is to do nothing against one's conscience. With this secret, we can enjoy life and have no fear from death.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: It is not love that should be depicted as blind, but self-love.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Is there anyone so wise as to learn by the experience of others?
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: By appreciation, we make excellence in others our own property.
values.author: Voltaire

values.authorQuote: Start every day off with a smile and get it over with.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: No doubt exists that all women are crazy; it's only a question of degree.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Horse sense is the thing a horse has which keeps it from betting on people.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: The clever cat eats cheese and breathes down rat holes with baited breath.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Once, during Prohibition, I was forced to live for days on nothing but food and water.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Always carry a flagon of whiskey in case of snakebite and furthermore always carry a small snake.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: I once spent a year in Philadelphia, I think it was on a Sunday.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Never cry over spilt milk, because it may have been poisoned.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: There are only two real ways to get ahead today - sell liquor or drink it.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. There's no point in being a damn fool about it.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: It was a woman who drove me to drink, and I never had the courtesy to thank her for it.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: There comes a time in the affairs of man when he must take the bull by the tail and face the situation.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Set up another case bartender! The best thing for a case of nerves is a case of Scotch.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: I never drink water; that is the stuff that rusts pipes.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: The best cure for insomnia is to get a lot of sleep.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Ah, the patter of little feet around the house. There's nothing like having a midget for a butler.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Women are like elephants. I like to look at 'em, but I wouldn't want to own one.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Last week, I went to Philadelphia, but it was closed.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: You can't trust water: Even a straight stick turns crooked in it.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Now don't say you can't swear off drinking; it's easy. I've done it a thousand times.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Drown in a cold vat of whiskey? Death, where is thy sting?
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Don't worry about your heart, it will last you as long as you live.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Show me a great actor and I'll show you a lousy husband. Show me a great actress, and you've seen the devil.
values.author: W. C. Fields

values.authorQuote: Education must not simply teach work - it must teach Life.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: A system of education is not one thing, nor does it have a single definite object, nor is it a mere matter of schools. Education is that whole system of human training within and without the school house walls, which molds and develops men.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: Education is that whole system of human training within and without the school house walls, which molds and develops men.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: The Negro race, like all races, is going to be saved by its exceptional men. The problem of education, then, among Negroes must first of all deal with the Talented Tenth; it is the problem of developing the Best of this race that they may guide the Mass away from the contamination and death of the Worst, in their own and other races.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: Education is the development of power and ideal.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: When you have mastered numbers, you will in fact no longer be reading numbers, any more than you read words when reading books You will be reading meanings.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: Most men today cannot conceive of a freedom that does not involve somebody's slavery.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: The problem of the twentieth century is the problem of the color line: the relation of the darker to the lighter races of men in Asia and Africa, in America and the islands of the sea.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: The cost of liberty is less than the price of repression.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: A classic is a book that doesn't have to be written again.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: Men we shall have only as we make manhood the object of the work of the schools - intelligence, broad sympathy, knowledge of the world that was and is, and of the relation of men to it - this is the curriculum of that Higher Education which must underlie true life.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: Believe in life! Always human beings will live and progress to greater, broader, and fuller life.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: Before and after emancipation, the Negro, in self-defense, was propelled toward the white employer. The endowments of wealthy white men have developed great institutions of learning for the Negro, but the freedom of action on the part of these same universities has been curtailed in proportion as they are indebted to white philanthropies.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: All art is propaganda, and ever must be, despite the wailing of the purists. I stand in utter shamelessness and say that whatever art I have for writing has been used always for propaganda for gaining the right of black folk to love and enjoy. I do not care a damn for any art that is not used for propaganda.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: If white people need colleges to furnish teachers, ministers, lawyers, and doctors, do black people need nothing of the sort?
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: I believe in the Prince of Peace. I believe that War is Murder. I believe that armies and navies are at bottom the tinsel and braggadocio of oppression and wrong, and I believe that the wicked conquest of weaker and darker nations by nations whiter and stronger but foreshadows the death of that strength.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: The ruling of men is the effort to direct the individual actions of many persons toward some end. This end theoretically should be the greatest good of all, but no human group has ever reached this ideal because of ignorance and selfishness.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: I had a happy childhood and acceptance in the community.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: Make yourself do unpleasant things so as to gain the upper hand of your soul.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: To stimulate wildly weak and untrained minds is to play with mighty fires.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: But what of black women?... I most sincerely doubt if any other race of women could have brought its fineness up through so devilish a fire.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: The Talented Tenth of the Negro race must be made leaders of thought and missionaries of culture among their people.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: For the Negro, Andrew Johnson did less than nothing when once he realized that the chief beneficiary of labor and economic reform in the South would be freedmen. His inability to picture Negroes as men made him oppose efforts to give them land; oppose national efforts to educate them; and above all things, oppose their rights to vote.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: The slavery of Negroes in the South was not usually a deliberately cruel and oppressive system. It did not mean systematic starvation or murder.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: All men cannot go to college, but some men must; every isolated group or nation must have its yeast, must have, for the talented few, centers of training where men are not so mystified and befuddled by the hard and necessary toil of earning a living as to have no aims higher than their bellies and no God greater than Gold.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: From the day of its birth, the anomaly of slavery plagued a nation which asserted the equality of all men, and sought to derive powers of government from the consent of the governed. Within sound of the voices of those who said this lived more than half a million black slaves, forming nearly one-fifth of the population of a new nation.
values.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
values.authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

values.authorQuote: Quality is pride of workmanship.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: A bad system will beat a good person every time.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: If you can't describe what you are doing as a process, you don't know what you're doing.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: It is not necessary to change. Survival is not mandatory.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: We are here to make another world.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: It is not enough to do your best; you must know what to do, and then do your best.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: The prevailing - and foolish - attitude is that a good manager can be a good manager anywhere, with no special knowledge of the production process he's managing. A man with a financial background may know nothing about manufacturing shoes or cars, but he's put in charge anyway.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: People with targets and jobs dependent upon meeting them will probably meet the targets - even if they have to destroy the enterprise to do it.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: Innovation comes from the producer - not from the customer.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: All anyone asks for is a chance to work with pride.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: Rational behavior requires theory. Reactive behavior requires only reflex action.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: Eliminate numerical quotas, including Management by Objectives.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: The average American worker has fifty interruptions a day, of which seventy percent have nothing to do with work.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: Declining productivity and quality means your unit production costs stay high but you don't have as much to sell. Your workers don't want to be paid less, so to maintain profits, you increase your prices. That's inflation.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: I predicted in 1950 that in five years, manufacturers the world over would be screaming for protection. It took only four years.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: No one knows the cost of a defective product - don't tell me you do. You know the cost of replacing it, but not the cost of a dissatisfied customer.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: Profit in business comes from repeat customers, customers that boast about your project or service, and that bring friends with them.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: Research shows that the climate of an organization influences an individual's contribution far more than the individual himself.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: If you don't understand how to run an efficient operation, new machinery will just give you new problems of operation and maintenance. The sure way to increase productivity is to better administrate man and machine.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: In 1945, the world was in a shambles. American companies had no competition. So nobody really thought much about quality. Why should they? The world bought everything America produced. It was a prescription for disaster.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: Lack of knowledge... that is the problem.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: 'Quality' means what will sell and do a customer some good - at least try to.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: The emphasis should be on why we do a job.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: I am forever learning and changing.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: If you do not know how to ask the right question, you discover nothing.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: The big problems are where people don't realise they have one in the first place.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we're curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: You can design and create, and build the most wonderful place in the world. But it takes people to make the dream a reality.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Times and conditions change so rapidly that we must keep our aim constantly focused on the future.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: It's kind of fun to do the impossible.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Movies can and do have tremendous influence in shaping young lives in the realm of entertainment towards the ideals and objectives of normal adulthood.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: There is more treasure in books than in all the pirate's loot on Treasure Island.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Mickey Mouse popped out of my mind onto a drawing pad 20 years ago on a train ride from Manhattan to Hollywood at a time when business fortunes of my brother Roy and myself were at lowest ebb and disaster seemed right around the corner.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Of all of our inventions for mass communication, pictures still speak the most universally understood language.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: When you believe in a thing, believe in it all the way, implicitly and unquestionable.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: I only hope that we don't lose sight of one thing - that it was all started by a mouse.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: You're dead if you aim only for kids. Adults are only kids grown up, anyway.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Animation offers a medium of story telling and visual entertainment which can bring pleasure and information to people of all ages everywhere in the world.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: I do not like to repeat successes, I like to go on to other things.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Our heritage and ideals, our code and standards - the things we live by and teach our children - are preserved or diminished by how freely we exchange ideas and feelings.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Mickey Mouse is, to me, a symbol of independence. He was a means to an end.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: We believed in our idea - a family park where parents and children could have fun- together.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: You reach a point where you don't work for money.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Of all the things I've done, the most vital is coordinating those who work with me and aiming their efforts at a certain goal.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
values.author: Walt Whitman

values.authorQuote: I am as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best.

values.authorQuote: Simplicity is the glory of expression.

values.authorQuote: I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars.

values.authorQuote: To me, every hour of the day and night is an unspeakably perfect miracle.

values.authorQuote: Give me odorous at sunrise a garden of beautiful flowers where I can walk undisturbed.

values.authorQuote: The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.

values.authorQuote: I no doubt deserved my enemies, but I don't believe I deserved my friends.

values.authorQuote: I see great things in baseball. It's our game - the American game.

values.authorQuote: The future is no more uncertain than the present.

values.authorQuote: I accept reality and dare not question it.

values.authorQuote: Viewed freely, the English language is the accretion and growth of every dialect, race, and range of time, and is both the free and compacted composition of all.

values.authorQuote: Every moment of light and dark is a miracle.

values.authorQuote: Be curious, not judgmental.

values.authorQuote: I exist as I am, that is enough.

values.authorQuote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.

values.authorQuote: The genius of the United States is not best or most in its executives or legislatures, nor in its ambassadors or authors or colleges, or churches, or parlors, nor even in its newspapers or inventors, but always most in the common people.

values.authorQuote: A morning-glory at my window satisfies me more than the metaphysics of books.

values.authorQuote: The beauty of independence, departure, actions that rely on themselves.

values.authorQuote: Oh while I live, to be the ruler of life, not a slave, to meet life as a powerful conqueror, and nothing exterior to me will ever take command of me.

values.authorQuote: The shallow consider liberty a release from all law, from every constraint. The wise man sees in it, on the contrary, the potent Law of Laws.

values.authorQuote: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then I contradict myself, I am large, I contain multitudes.

values.authorQuote: And your very flesh shall be a great poem.

values.authorQuote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.

values.authorQuote: After you have exhausted what there is in business, politics, conviviality, and so on - have found that none of these finally satisfy, or permanently wear - what remains? Nature remains.

values.authorQuote: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.

values.authorQuote: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.

values.authorQuote: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.

values.authorQuote: Chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be broken.

values.authorQuote: Predicting rain doesn't count. Building arks does.

values.authorQuote: Time is the friend of the wonderful company, the enemy of the mediocre.

values.authorQuote: I bought a company in the mid-'90s called Dexter Shoe and paid $400 million for it. And it went to zero. And I gave about $400 million worth of Berkshire stock, which is probably now worth $400 billion. But I've made lots of dumb decisions. That's part of the game.

values.authorQuote: It's better to hang out with people better than you. Pick out associates whose behavior is better than yours and you'll drift in that direction.

values.authorQuote: Should you find yourself in a chronically leaking boat, energy devoted to changing vessels is likely to be more productive than energy devoted to patching leaks.

values.authorQuote: When you combine ignorance and leverage, you get some pretty interesting results.

values.authorQuote: Derivatives are financial weapons of mass destruction.

values.authorQuote: If past history was all there was to the game, the richest people would be librarians.

values.authorQuote: Everything that's created comes out of silence. Your thoughts emerge from the nothingness of silence. Your words come out of this void. Your very essence emerged from emptiness. All creativity requires some stillness.

values.authorQuote: The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don't know anything about.

values.authorQuote: The essential lesson I've learned in life is to just be yourself. Treasure the magnificent being that you are and recognize first and foremost you're not here as a human being only. You're a spiritual being having a human experience.

values.authorQuote: To be more childlike, you don't have to give up being an adult. The fully integrated person is capable of being both an adult and a child simultaneously. values.authorQuote: Conflict cannot survive without your participation.
values.author: Wayne Dyer

values.authorQuote: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.

values.authorQuote: Fear is present when we forget that we are a part of God's divine design. values.author: Wayne Dyer

values.authorQuote: Self-worth comes from one thing - thinking that you are worthy.

values.authorQuote: Begin noticing and being careful about keeping your imagination free of thoughts that you do not wish to materialize. Instead, initiate a practice of filling your creative thoughts to overflow with ideas and wishes that you fully intend to manifest. Honor your imaginings regardless of others seeing them as crazy or impossible.

values.authorQuote: Relationships based on obligation lack dignity.

values.authorQuote: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.

values.authorQuote: Miracles come in moments. Be ready and willing.

values.authorQuote: Judgements prevent us from seeing the good that lies beyond appearances.

values.authorQuote: Having a mind that is open to everything and attached to nothing seems to me to be one of the most basic principles that you can adopt to contribute to individual and world peace.

values.authorQuote: Become slower in your journey through life. Practice yoga and meditation if you suffer from 'hurry sickness.' Become more introspective by visiting quiet places such as churches, museums, mountains and lakes. Give yourself permission to read at least one novel a month for pleasure.
values.author: Wayne Dyer

values.authorQuote: You do indeed have a past, but not now! And, yes, you have a future, but not now! You can consume your now with thoughts of 'then' and 'maybe,' but that will keep you from the inner peace you could experience.

values.authorQuote: Transformation literally means going beyond your form.

values.authorQuote: To cherish what remains of the Earth and to foster its renewal is our only legitimate hope of survival.

values.authorQuote: We cannot know the whole truth, which belongs to God alone, but our task nevertheless is to seek to know what is true. values.authorQuote: I love playing the macho guy who looks like an idiot.

values.authorQuote: All you have in comedy, in general, is just going with your instincts. You can only hope that other people think that what you think is funny is funny. I don't have an answer but I just try to plough straight ahead.

values.authorQuote: I have only been funny about seventy four per cent of the time. Yes I think that is right. Seventy-four per cent of the time.

values.authorQuote: James Caan told me at the end of filming 'Elf' that he had been waiting through the whole film for me to be funny - and I never was.

values.authorQuote: Often times I'm confronted with a quote that I don't remember saying. So, on one hand it's very flattering, it is just so surreal.

values.authorQuote: I'm a Progressive. Much in the same way our founding fathers - who, oddly enough, wouldn't get elected today - were Progressives.

values.authorQuote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: Do what you will, this world's a fiction and is made up of contradiction.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: Without contraries is no progression. Attraction and repulsion, reason and energy, love and hate, are necessary to human existence.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: The true method of knowledge is experiment.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: Opposition is true friendship.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: The glory of Christianity is to conquer by forgiveness.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: You never know what is enough unless you know what is more than enough.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: The weak in courage is strong in cunning.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: He who binds to himself a joy Does the winged life destroy; But he who kisses the joy as it flies Lives in eternity's sun rise.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: He whose face gives no light, shall never become a star.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: What is now proved was once only imagined.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: Can I see another's woe, and not be in sorrow too? Can I see another's grief, and not seek for kind relief?
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: If the doors of perception were cleansed everything would appear to man as it is, infinite.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: Love seeketh not itself to please, nor for itself hath any care, but for another gives its ease, and builds a Heaven in Hell's despair.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: If the fool would persist in his folly he would become wise.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: The tigers of wrath are wiser than the horses of instruction.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: If a thing loves, it is infinite.
values.author: William Blake

values.authorQuote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Come away, O human child: To the waters and the wild with a fairy, hand in hand, For the world's more full of weeping than you can understand.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Come Fairies, take me out of this dull world, for I would ride with you upon the wind and dance upon the mountains like a flame!
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Talent perceives differences; genius, unity.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: How can we know the dancer from the dance?
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: If suffering brings wisdom, I would wish to be less wise.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: I wonder anybody does anything at Oxford but dream and remember, the place is so beautiful. One almost expects the people to sing instead of speaking. It is all like an opera.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Take, if you must, this little bag of dreams, Unloose the cord, and they will wrap you round.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: But I, being poor, have only my dreams; I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: When you are old and gray and full of sleep, and nodding by the fire, take down this book and slowly read, and dream of the soft look your eyes had once, and of their shadows deep.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: One should not lose one's temper unless one is certain of getting more and more angry to the end.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Joy is of the will which labours, which overcomes obstacles, which knows triumph.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: I heard the old, old, men say 'all that's beautiful drifts away, like the waters.'
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: The best lack all conviction, while the worst are full of passionate intensity.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Life is a long preparation for something that never happens.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: But was there ever dog that praised his fleas?
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Those that I fight I do not hate, those that I guard I do not love.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Too long a sacrifice can make a stone of the heart. O when may it suffice?
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: The only business of the head in the world is to bow a ceaseless obeisance to the heart.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: Wine comes in at the mouth And love comes in at the eye; That's all we shall know for truth Before we grow old and die.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: We are happy when for everything inside us there is a corresponding something outside us.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: People who lean on logic and philosophy and rational exposition end by starving the best part of the mind.
values.author: William Butler Yeats

values.authorQuote: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: Pessimism leads to weakness, optimism to power.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: Acceptance of what has happened is the first step to overcoming the consequences of any misfortune.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: Whenever you're in conflict with someone, there is one factor that can make the difference between damaging your relationship and deepening it. That factor is attitude.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: The greatest use of a life is to spend it on something that will outlast it.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: It is our attitude at the beginning of a difficult task which, more than anything else, will affect its successful outcome.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: Begin to be now what you will be hereafter.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: If you care enough for a result, you will most certainly attain it.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: If you want a quality, act as if you already had it.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: Belief creates the actual fact.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: Why should we think upon things that are lovely? Because thinking determines life. It is a common habit to blame life upon the environment. Environment modifies life but does not govern life. The soul is stronger than its surroundings.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: To be conscious means not simply to be, but to be reported, known, to have awareness of one's being added to that being.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: The world we see that seems so insane is the result of a belief system that is not working. To perceive the world differently, we must be willing to change our belief system, let the past slip away, expand our sense of now, and dissolve the fear in our minds.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: There is no more miserable human being than one in whom nothing is habitual but indecision.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: To change ones life: Start immediately. Do it flamboyantly.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: When you have to make a choice and don't make it, that is in itself a choice.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: Man can alter his life by altering his thinking.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: There is only one thing a philosopher can be relied upon to do, and that is to contradict other philosophers.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: To be radical, an empiricism must neither admit into its constructions any element that is not directly experienced, nor exclude from them any element that is directly experienced.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: Faith means belief in something concerning which doubt is theoretically possible.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: If you believe that feeling bad or worrying long enough will change a past or future event, then you are residing on another planet with a different reality system.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: Most people never run far enough on their first wind to find out they've got a second.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: To study the abnormal is the best way of understanding the normal.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.
values.author: William James

values.authorQuote: The good physician treats the disease; the great physician treats the patient who has the disease.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: Medicine is a science of uncertainty and an art of probability.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: Observe, record, tabulate, communicate. Use your five senses. Learn to see, learn to hear, learn to feel, learn to smell, and know that by practice alone you can become expert.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: He who studies medicine without books sails an uncharted sea, but he who studies medicine without patients does not go to sea at all.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: The best preparation for tomorrow is to do today's work superbly well.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: Look wise, say nothing, and grunt. Speech was given to conceal thought.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: The first duties of the physician is to educate the masses not to take medicine.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: No bubble is so iridescent or floats longer than that blown by the successful teacher.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: Soap and water and common sense are the best disinfectants.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: To have striven, to have made the effort, to have been true to certain ideals - this alone is worth the struggle.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: The value of experience is not in seeing much, but in seeing wisely.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: We are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we can from life.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: There are, in truth, no specialties in medicine, since to know fully many of the most important diseases a man must be familiar with their manifestations in many organs.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: It is much more important to know what sort of a patient has a disease than what sort of a disease a patient has.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: The very first step towards success in any occupation is to become interested in it.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: The young physician starts life with 20 drugs for each disease, and the old physician ends life with one drug for 20 diseases.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: The teacher's life should have three periods, study until twenty-five, investigation until forty, profession until sixty, at which age I would have him retired on a double allowance.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: There is no disease more conducive to clinical humility than aneurysm of the aorta.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: In seeking absolute truth we aim at the unattainable and must be content with broken portions.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: No human being is constituted to know the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth; and even the best of men must be content with fragments, with partial glimpses, never the full fruition.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: The greater the ignorance the greater the dogmatism.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: One of the first duties of the physician is to educate the masses not to take medicine.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: It is much simpler to buy books than to read them and easier to read them than to absorb their contents.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: The future is today.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: Variability is the law of life, and as no two faces are the same, so no two bodies are alike, and no two individuals react alike and behave alike under the abnormal conditions which we know as disease.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: To study the phenomena of disease without books is to sail an uncharted sea, while to study books without patients is not to go to sea at all.
values.author: William Osler
values.authorOccupation: Physician, one of the four founding professors of Johns Hopkins Hospital

values.authorQuote: The aim of education is the knowledge, not of facts, but of values.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: After one look at this planet any visitor from outer space would say 'I want to see the manager.'
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: The purpose of technology is not to confuse the brain but to serve the body.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: You can't fake quality any more than you can fake a good meal.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Sometimes paranoia's just having all the facts.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Changes... can only be effected by alterations in the original. The only thing not prerecorded in a prerecorded universe are the prerecordings themselves. The copies can only repeat themselves word for word. A virus is a copy. You can pretty it up, cut it up, scramble it - it will reassemble in the same form.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: My relationships with my cats has saved me from a deadly, pervasive ignorance.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: I see no reason why the artistic world can't absolutely merge with Madison Avenue. Pop art is a move in that direction. Why can't we have advertisements with beautiful words and beautiful images?
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Our national drug is alcohol. We tend to regard the use any other drug with special horror.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Nothing is true, everything is permitted.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: You must learn to exist with no religion, no country, no allies. You must learn to live alone in silence.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Language is a virus from outer space.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Junk is the ideal product... the ultimate merchandise. No sales talk necessary. The client will crawl through a sewer and beg to buy.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Virtue is simply happiness, and happiness is a by-product of function. You are happy when you are functioning.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Most of the trouble in this world has been caused by folks who can't mind their own business, because they have no business of their own to mind, any more than a smallpox virus has.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Happiness is a byproduct of function, purpose, and conflict; those who seek happiness for itself seek victory without war.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Silence is only frightening to people who are compulsively verbalizing.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: If everyone is to be made responsible for everything they do, you must extend responsibility beyond the level of conscious intention.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Americans have a special horror of giving up control, of letting things happen in their own way without interference.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Visual art and writing don't exist on an aesthetic hierarchy that positions one above the other, because each is capable of things the other can't do at all. Sometimes one picture is equal to 30 pages of discourse, just as there are things images are completely incapable of communicating.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: After a shooting spree, they always want to take the guns away from the people who didn't do it. I sure as hell wouldn't want to live in a society where the only people allowed guns are the police and the military.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Artists to my mind are the real architects of change, and not the political legislators who implement change after the fact.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: A functioning police state needs no police.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Admittedly, a homosexual can be conditioned to react sexually to a woman, or to an old boot for that matter. In fact, both homo - and heterosexual experimental subjects have been conditioned to react sexually to an old boot, and you can save a lot of money that way.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Man is an artifact designed for space travel. He is not designed to remain in his present biologic state any more than a tadpole is designed to remain a tadpole.
values.author: William S. Burroughs

values.authorQuote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: A fool thinks himself to be wise, but a wise man knows himself to be a fool.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: When a father gives to his son, both laugh; when a son gives to his father, both cry.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: If music be the food of love, play on.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: There is nothing either good or bad but thinking makes it so.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: No legacy is so rich as honesty.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: Hell is empty and all the devils are here.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: What's in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: Cowards die many times before their deaths; the valiant never taste of death but once.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: The course of true love never did run smooth.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: We are such stuff as dreams are made on; and our little life is rounded with a sleep.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: Better three hours too soon than a minute too late.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: Good night, good night! Parting is such sweet sorrow, that I shall say good night till it be morrow.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: How far that little candle throws its beams! So shines a good deed in a naughty world.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: This above all; to thine own self be true.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: I say there is no darkness but ignorance.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: There is a tide in the affairs of men, Which taken at the flood, leads on to fortune. Omitted, all the voyage of their life is bound in shallows and in miseries. On such a full sea are we now afloat. And we must take the current when it serves, or lose our ventures.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: Like as the waves make towards the pebbl'd shore, so do our minutes, hasten to their end.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: Better a witty fool than a foolish wit.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: Doubt thou the stars are fire, Doubt that the sun doth move. Doubt truth to be a liar, But never doubt I love.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: This life, which had been the tomb of his virtue and of his honour, is but a walking shadow; a poor player, that struts and frets his hour upon the stage, and then is heard no more: it is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.
values.author: William Shakespeare

values.authorQuote: I am tired and sick of war. Its glory is all moonshine. It is only those who have neither fired a shot nor heard the shrieks and groans of the wounded who cry aloud for blood, for vengeance, for desolation. War is hell.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: War is cruelty. There is no use trying to reform it. The crueler it is, the sooner it will be over.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: My aim, then, was to whip the rebels, to humble their pride, to follow them to their inmost recesses, and make them fear and dread us. Fear is the beginning of wisdom.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: If I had my choice I would kill every reporter in the world, but I am sure we would be getting reports from Hell before breakfast.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: But, my dear sirs, when peace does come, you may call on me for any thing. Then will I share with you the last cracker, and watch with you to shield your homes and families against danger from every quarter.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: I intend to make Georgia howl.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: This war differs from other wars, in this particular. We are not fighting armies but a hostile people, and must make old and young, rich and poor, feel the hard hand of war.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: Courage - a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger, and a mental willingness to endure it.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: If nominated, I will not run; if elected, I will not serve.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: I make up my opinions from facts and reasoning, and not to suit any body but myself. If people don't like my opinions, it makes little difference as I don't solicit their opinions or votes.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: I hate newspapermen. They come into camp and pick up their camp rumors and print them as facts. I regard them as spies, which, in truth, they are.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: It is only those who have neither fired a shot nor heard the shrieks and groans of the wounded who cry aloud for blood, more vengeance, more desolation. War is hell.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: I would make this war as severe as possible, and show no symptoms of tiring till the South begs for mercy.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: My aim then was to whip the rebels, to humble their pride, to follow them to their inmost recesses, and make them fear and dread us.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: Every attempt to make war easy and safe will result in humiliation and disaster.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: If you don't have my army supplied, and keep it supplied, we'll eat your mules up, sir.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: There's many a boy here today who looks on war as all glory but it is all hell.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: He belonged to that army known as invincible in peace, invisible in war.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: In our Country... one class of men makes war and leaves another to fight it out.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: I think I understand what military fame is; to be killed on the field of battle and have your name misspelled in the newspapers.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: If the people raise a great howl against my barbarity and cruelty, I will answer that war is war, and not popularity seeking.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: The voice of the people is the voice of humbug.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: I will accept no commission that would tend to create a rivalry with Grant. I want him to hold what he has earned and got. I have all the rank I want.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: You may as well say, 'That's a valiant flea that dare eat his breakfast on the lip of a lion.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: War is hell.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: There is many a boy here today who looks on war as all glory, but, boys, it is all hell.
values.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

values.authorQuote: Come forth into the light of things, let nature be your teacher.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: The flower that smells the sweetest is shy and lowly.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: Poetry is the spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings: it takes its origin from emotion recollected in tranquility.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: The ocean is a mighty harmonist.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: With an eye made quiet by the power of harmony, and the deep power of joy, we see into the life of things.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: How does the Meadow flower its bloom unfold? Because the lovely little flower is free down to its root, and in that freedom bold.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: Not without hope we suffer and we mourn.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: The best portion of a good man's life is his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: Life is divided into three terms - that which was, which is, and which will be. Let us learn from the past to profit by the present, and from the present, to live better in the future.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: Suffering is permanent, obscure and dark, And shares the nature of infinity.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: Nature never did betray the heart that loved her.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: To me the meanest flower that blows can give thoughts that do often lie too deep for tears.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: For I have learned to look on nature, not as in the hour of thoughtless youth, but hearing oftentimes the still, sad music of humanity.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: A multitude of causes unknown to former times are now acting with a combined force to blunt the discriminating powers of the mind, and unfitting it for all voluntary exertion to reduce it to a state of almost savage torpor.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: What is pride? A rocket that emulates the stars.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: Getting and spending, we lay waste our powers.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: To begin, begin.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: That though the radiance which was once so bright be now forever taken from my sight. Though nothing can bring back the hour of splendor in the grass, glory in the flower. We will grieve not, rather find strength in what remains behind.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: What we need is not the will to believe, but the wish to find out.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: The world is too much with us; late and soon, getting and spending, we lay waste our powers: Little we see in Nature that is ours.
values.author: William Wordsworth

values.authorQuote: Pictures deface walls more often than they decorate them.
values.author: William Wordsworth

A lot of Mexicans - the blacks and the whites and the Mexicans, all out there singing, and it was like an opera in the cotton fields, and I can still hear it in the music that I write and play today.

values.authorQuote: Marriage is a difficult project. When seven years have passed and all your body's cells have been replaced, you're meant to experience that seven-year itch.

values.authorOccupation: Artist, peace activist, singer, songwriter, feminist

values.authorQuote: DJs are in incredible competition, musically. And they are the most musically creative and sensitive people in all the music charts. I am amazed how they are.
values.author: Yoko Ono
values.authorOccupation: Artist, peace activist, singer, songwriter, feminist

values.authorQuote: I think if you give in and accept society's stereotypes, then you start thinking, 'I cannot dance till late at night because I'm 70.'
values.author: Yoko Ono
values.authorOccupation: Artist, peace activist, singer, songwriter, feminist

values.authorQuote: I relate to happiness as an ecstatic moment - something you don't create, you encounter.
values.author: Yoko Ono
values.authorOccupation: Artist, peace activist, singer, songwriter, feminist

values.authorQuote: When I turned 60, it didn't bother me at all.
values.author: Yoko Ono
values.authorOccupation: Artist, peace activist, singer, songwriter, feminist

values.authorQuote: I thought art was a verb, rather than a noun.
values.author: Yoko Ono
values.authorOccupation: Artist, peace activist, singer, songwriter, feminist

values.authorQuote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: If people like you, they'll listen to you, but if they trust you, they'll do business with you.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Try to look at your weakness and convert it into your strength. That's success.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: You were born to win, but to be a winner, you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: You were designed for accomplishment, engineered for success, and endowed with the seeds of greatness.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Isn't it amazing how much stuff we get done the day before vacation?
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: With integrity, you have nothing to fear, since you have nothing to hide. With integrity, you will do the right thing, so you will have no guilt.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Positive thinking will let you use the ability which you have, and that is awesome.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing - that's why we recommend it daily.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Gratitude is the healthiest of all human emotions. The more you express gratitude for what you have, the more likely you will have even more to express gratitude for.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Take time to be kind and to say 'thank you.'
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Be grateful for what you have and stop complaining - it bores everybody else, does you no good, and doesn't solve any problems.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: When you catch a glimpse of your potential, that's when passion is born.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: There are no traffic jams on the extra mile.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Honesty and integrity are by far the most important assets of an entrepreneur.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: You never know when a moment and a few sincere words can have an impact on a life.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Time can be an ally or an enemy. What it becomes depends entirely upon you, your goals, and your determination to use every available minute.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: It is true that integrity alone won't make you a leader, but without integrity you will never be one.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: Failure is a detour, not a dead-end street.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: You can have everything in life you want, if you will just help other people get what they want.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: If you aim at nothing, you'll hit it every time.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: You cannot climb the ladder of success dressed in the costume of failure.
values.author: Zig Ziglar

values.authorQuote: I have always said that everyone is in sales. Maybe you don't hold the title of salesperson, but if the business you are in requires you to deal with people, you, my friend, are in sales.
values.author: Zig Ziglar
